title: Seoul Metro
text:
Seoul Transportation Corporation dba Seoul Metro (<a href="Hangul">Hangul</a>: ), is a <a href="municipal-owned%20corporation">municipal-owned corporation</a> owned by <a href="Seoul%20Metropolitan%20Government">Seoul Metropolitan Government</a>, and one of the two major operators of <a href="Seoul%20Metropolitan%20Subway">Seoul Metropolitan Subway</a> with <a href="Korail">Korail</a>.
Lines and sections.
Seoul Metro's service covers part of lines <a href="Seoul%20Subway%20Line%201">1</a>, <a href="Seoul%20Subway%20Line%203">3</a>, <a href="Seoul%20Subway%20Line%204">4</a> and all of lines <a href="Seoul%20Subway%20Line%202">2</a>, <a href="Seoul%20Subway%20Line%205">5</a>, <a href="Seoul%20Subway%20Line%206">6</a>, <a href="Seoul%20Subway%20Line%207">7</a>, <a href="Seoul%20Subway%20Line%208">8</a> & <a href="Seoul%20Subway%20Line%209">9</a>. Trains from Lines 1, 3 and 4 <a href="Through%20train">through operate</a> with Korail services. Seoul Metro controls the railways and stations owned by the <a href="Seoul%20Metropolitan%20Government">Seoul Metropolitan Government</a>.
Subway etiquette with Bread Barbershop characters.
In June 2020, the etiquette was uploaded on both <a href="YouTube">YouTube</a> channels, their own YouTube channel, and the Korean Bread Barbershop channel. The company said that they can meet Master Bread and his friends on June 10, 2020. The etiquette promotes that bringing food in a subway is prohibited.
